scenario 1.background: At a casual meeting at the polo field, Keith decides to subtly confront Albert about his suspicions regarding Albert's intentions at work.

dialogue.Keith: Albert, I've been thinking about the recent project proposals. Have you discussed any of your thoughts with the boss lately?
dialogue.Albert: Not really, Keith. I've been keeping most of my ideas between us in the team. Why do you ask?

dialogue.Keith: Oh, no reason. Just curious how you approach sharing ideas. I sometimes worry about the right balance between sharing and holding back.
dialogue.Albert: I think it's crucial to be transparent, especially with the team. We're all in this together, right?

scenario 2.background: After seeing Albert's genuine reaction, Keith starts to believe he might have misjudged Albert. Feeling guilty, he decides to apologize and propose a collaborative project.

dialogue.Keith: Albert, I want to apologize if I seemed a bit off the other day. I think I may have misjudged the situation.

dialogue.Keith: I've been thinking, why don't we collaborate on a new initiative? I believe we could create something great together.
dialogue.Albert: That sounds like a fantastic idea, Keith! Let's sit down and hash out some details soon.

scenario 3.background: Feeling excited and optimistic about the potential success of their collaborative project, Keith prepares to pitch the idea enthusiastically to Albert.

dialogue.Keith: Albert, I've put together some thoughts on our project. I really think this could be a game-changer for both of us.

dialogue.Keith: Here’s the plan and potential benefits. I believe if we execute it well, it could really boost our careers and bring significant benefits to the company.
dialogue.Albert: This looks impressive, Keith. I'm excited to get started on this with you.

scenario 4.background: Keith starts to worry that Albert might get more credit for the project because of his higher degree. To ensure his contributions are equally recognized, he begins documenting all his contributions meticulously.

dialogue.Keith: Albert, I've been thinking about how we're documenting our project progress. I believe it's important we both get equal recognition for our work.
dialogue.Albert: Absolutely, Keith. I think it’s fair we keep detailed records of our contributions. Let’s make sure everything is on paper.

dialogue.Keith: I've started a log of all our meetings and the ideas each of us has contributed. I think it will help us when it comes time to present to the higher-ups.
dialogue.Albert: That’s a great initiative, Keith. Transparency will definitely help us both.

scenario 5.background: Realizing that teamwork and mutual support lead to better outcomes than competition, Keith decides to fully support the project without focusing on who gets more credit.

dialogue.Keith: Albert, I've been reflecting on our work together, and I truly believe that our collaboration is more important than who gets the credit.

dialogue.Keith: Exactly, so let's keep focusing on pushing the project forward. I'll make sure to highlight your contributions in our next team meeting.
